name: St. Francis of Assisi
summary: Francis of Assisi was an Italian Catholic friar, deacon, and mystic. He founded the Franciscan Order and is one of the most venerated religious figures in Christianity. He is known for his devotion to poverty, his love of nature, and for receiving the stigmata. He is the patron saint of Italy, animals, and the environment.

name: St. Dominic
summary: Dominic was a Castilian priest and founder of the Dominican Order. He is known for his preaching against the Albigensian heresy and for establishing an order dedicated to preaching and study. The Dominicans became one of the most influential religious orders in the Middle Ages, producing many theologians and scholars.

name: St. Thomas Aquinas
summary: Thomas Aquinas was an Italian Dominican friar, philosopher, and theologian. He is considered one of the greatest theologians in Church history and is the foremost classical proponent of natural theology. His 'Summa Theologica' is one of the most influential works in Western philosophy and theology. He is venerated as a Doctor of the Church and is the patron saint of students and schools.

name: St. Bonaventure
summary: Bonaventure was an Italian Franciscan theologian and philosopher. He was a contemporary of Thomas Aquinas and is considered one of the greatest medieval theologians. He served as Minister General of the Franciscan Order and was made a cardinal. He is known for his synthesis of Augustinian theology with Aristotelian philosophy and is venerated as a Doctor of the Church.

writings.title: The Journey of the Mind to God

name: St. Clare of Assisi
summary: Clare of Assisi was an Italian saint and one of the first followers of Francis of Assisi. She founded the Order of Poor Ladies, later known as the Poor Clares, a contemplative order for women. She is known for her devotion to poverty, her miracles, and for being the first woman to write a monastic rule. She is the patron saint of television and eye diseases.

name: St. Anthony of Padua
summary: Anthony of Padua was a Portuguese Franciscan friar and priest. He is known as one of the greatest preachers of his time and is venerated as a Doctor of the Church. He is the patron saint of lost things and is one of the most popular saints in the Catholic Church. His preaching was said to convert many heretics and his miracles were numerous.

name: St. Elizabeth of Hungary

locations.description: Queen of Hungary, then Franciscan tertiary

summary: Elizabeth of Hungary was a princess of the Kingdom of Hungary and Landgravine of Thuringia. After her husband's death, she became a Franciscan tertiary and dedicated her life to serving the poor and sick. She is known for her charity and is one of the most popular medieval saints. She is the patron saint of bakers, beggars, and the homeless.

name: Pope Innocent III
summary: Innocent III was Pope from 1198 to 1216 and is considered one of the most powerful and influential popes in history. He convened the Fourth Lateran Council, launched the Albigensian Crusade, and asserted papal authority over secular rulers. He supported the Franciscan and Dominican orders and worked to reform the Church. His pontificate marked the height of medieval papal power.

name: St. Albert the Great

locations.description: Bishop of Regensburg, teacher of Thomas Aquinas

summary: Albert the Great was a German Dominican friar, bishop, and philosopher. He was one of the greatest scholars of the Middle Ages and is known for his comprehensive knowledge of natural sciences, philosophy, and theology. He was the teacher of Thomas Aquinas and is venerated as a Doctor of the Church. He is the patron saint of scientists and students of the natural sciences.
